Sebastian Westcote's Wil1 TNA: PRO PROB 101105
pp 1–11* (3April: probate 14 April)
In the name of the moste glorious and blessed trynitie the father, the sonne,
and the holie ghost. so be yt./ I Sebastian westcote Almener of the Cathedrall
Churche of St. Pawle in London being greved with sycknes, being yet,of
perfect [of] mynde and memorye (to god I geve praise therefore) this third
daie of Aprill in the yere of our lord god 1582:/ And in the xxiiijth yere of the
raigne of oure most gracious soueraigne Ladye Cuene Elizabeth &c. make my
last will and testament in manner & fourme ensewing hereby revokyng all
other wylls and testamentes whatsoeuer by me heretofore made/ ffirst and
before all thinges Commending my soule vnto the mercie of my saviour Ihesus
Christ asking pardon for all my synnes and offences in his bytter death and
passion hoping in the last Iudgement daye to ryse and rest with this my
wretched bodie in his blessed kyngdome amonge his elect Comytting my
earthlie bodye vnto the earth to be buried at the ] discrecion of my executour
of this my said last will & testament hereafter named/ my worldlie goodes I

giue and dispose as followeth/. viz. ffirst I giue and bequeath to & amongest
the Petycannons of the said Cathedrall churche of St Pawle to bryng my bodie
to the Churche ffyve powndes/ And to & amongest the vycars of the same
Churche to bring my bodye lykewyse to churche fower powndes/ And to the
ten Chorasters of the same Churche ffyve powndes/ Item I giue to gyles
Clothier and Iohn Boult viz./ Gyles iij li. vj s. viij d./ And Boulte I giue fower
powndes./ To everye of the vergers of the same churche XS. a pece to bring me
to Churche/ To the keper of the vestrye iij s. iiij d./ To everie of the bellryngers
there iij s. iiij d./ To the poore of the parishe of Chimley where I was borne in
the Cowntie of devon iij li. To the poore within the towne of Tawnton in the
cowntye of Somerset xl s./ To the poore of kyrton in devon LS./] To the poore
of kingstone nere Taunton aforesaid VS./ To the poore of the pareshe of St
gregorie neere Pawles churche in London xx S./ To the poore prysoners within
the severall howses and prysons called the fflete, the marshalsey, the kynges
benche, the white Lyon in Southwark, the twoe Cownters, Newgate, Ludgate,
Bethelem, and the gatehowse in westmynster, to everie pryson vj s. viij d. a
pece/ Item I giue and bequeath to the vse of the Almenerye howse of the
said Cathedrall Churche of St Pawle where I nowe dwell, to be & remayne
vnto the, Tsame said Almenery howse to the vse of the Almener there for
the tyme beyng for ever towardes the furnishing of the same house, my chest
of vyalyns and vyalles to exercise and learne the children & Choristers there/
And also one table in the hall withe the frame A settle of ioyned worke, a
paire of great Iron Aundyrons there, the table, frame and settells, hanginges,
waynscot and Coubourd in the parlour there, The hanginges in myne owne
Chamber, the hangynges in the chamber over the kytchen The great Chest,
and great presse there/ the Coubourd & the great chest at the staieres hed,
fyve bedstedes, fyve mattresses, fyve pair of blanketes fyve bolsters of floxe fyve
Coverledes suche as are acustomablie vsed for the tenne Choresters, together
with all suche wood and Coales as shalbe lefte in the house, exceptinge some
necessarye fewell for my executour for the tyme beyng there vntill suche tyme
as the reste of the stuff be ryd oute of the house, A pestle and morter, the third
brasse panne, the worser kettle, the second & third brasse pott, a water Chafer,
the worser chaffingdishe, fyve latten Candlestickes, the second & third spytt,
the seconde pair of Aundyrons, one pair of tonges & a fyershovell of the
worser sorte a drippinge panne, twoe pair of hangers, a trevet, three of the
worser platters fowre of the worser dishes, the worst skommer, fowre poryngers
vj of the worst sawcers of pewter, one of the worser basons A pottle & a quarte
pott of pewter, twoe pynte pottes, the] worst chamberpotte/ More I giue to
the said Almenerye house to remayne for ever as aforesaid, twoe mazers bownd

9–10/ Chimley ... devon: Chulmleigh, Devon
19] said: intended for cancellation
11/ kyrton in devon: probably Cheriton, Devon

abowte withe sylver, one bygger, and the other lesser vj sylver spoones of the
smaller sorte with slyps/ All which said plate & househould stuff so by me as
aforesaide given to the said Almenery house (necessarye waste onlie excepted)
Iwill that an Inventarie Indentyd thereof to be made, one parte whereof I will
shalbe & remayne in the safe custodie of the worshipfull deane and Chapter
of the said Cathedrall churche & their successours, And the other parte thereof
to be delyveryd vnto the Almener of the said Cathedrall churche for the tyme
beyng, to thentent the said deane and Chapter maye at theire pleasures call the
Almener for the tyme beyng to an Accompte/ And for the sure delyverie of
the same to his successours for ever/ Item I giue & bequeath to my brother
george westcote xl S./ And to everye of his children xxvj s. viij d./ Item I giue
& bequeath vnto my syster Iaquet Goodinow x li. And] forgeve all suche debt
as she oweth me./ Item I giue & bequeath vnto Elizabeth westcote wydowe my
syster in Lawe twentie powndes, together with the Lease of westgrene which
Inowe have, and all ye household stuff, and kyene & Cattell there./ Item I
giue & bequeath vnto my brother Robert westcote xiij li. vj s. viij d./ And I
forgeve him all suche debtes as he oweth me/ To Andrew westcote his sone
x li.] And to everye of his other children xxx S./ Item I giue vnto Roger westcote,
Sebastian and ffrawnces westcote sonnes of my late brother william westcote,
to everye of them x li., allowyng suche thinges or somes of money I owe them*
Item I giue to the daughters of my syster Iaquet Goodinow iij li. a pece, beinge
fowre of them/ Item I giue & bequethe to my systers daughter which was
[married of late] marryed of late, towardes the buylding of her howse which
was bvrnt vj li. xiij s. iiij d./ And to her twoe children xx S. apece/ Item Igiue
& bequeath vnto ffrydiswide Clunye, widowe nowe beinge in howse with
me, the some of x li. and] the fourth featherbed perfourmed./ Item I giue to
Margarett Riche my syster in lawe xl s. in money./ Item I giue to lohn Thornley
and his syster ffraunces xxx S. apece. Item I geve to Henry Redford, & to
Elizabeth ffarthing dwelling att Bierton on the Countie of Buckes if they be
living at the tyme of my decease xx S. apece/ Item I giue to bartholomew
Redford xxx S./ Item I giue to Richard my man xxx S./ Item I geve to katheryn
my mayde servaunt iij li./ Item I giue to Thomas Bluet, Thomas Barsey,
Robert, and Iohn Aundersone nowe remayning in my howse to everye of them
V li. apece/ Item I geve to peter phillips likewise remayning with me vj li.
xiij S. iiij d./ Item I giue to Thomas venge iij li./ Item I giue to bromeham,
Richard Huse, Robert knight, Nicholas Carleton (blank) Baylie (blank) Nasyon,
& gregorye Bowryng sometymes children of the said Almenerye howse, to
everie of them xx S. apece/ Item I giue & bequeath to the right worshipfull
master Iustice Southcott ] my especiall good frend my gilt Cupp with the
cover having on the Cover St Sebastian/ Item to my lovyng frend mr Henry

Evans vj li. xiij s. iiij d./ and a lytle Cuppe of sylver & a cover with ij lytle
ringes on the cover/ Item Igiue to westcote that ys blynde iij li./ Item to my
frend Iustynian kydd gentleman a square sault gilted wroughte./ And whereas
I the said Sebastian westcote have in this my last will and testament given
& bequeathed vnto dyvers of the Children of my brothers & systers and to
other my frendes children all or the most parte of them nowe beyng verye
yonge and so by lawe not hable to dischardge my executour of the receight
of suche legacies as I haue given vnto them/ my will and meanyng is, that if
it shall happen anye of the said children to be putt fourthe apprentyces, that
the master & parentes of everie suche childe puttyng in sufficient assurance to
my executour to dischardge him against them & everie of them for the same
shall haue the Legacie of everye suche childe as by good discrecion of my
executour shalbe thought best ] for the benefytt of suche childe or children/
Item Igiue & bequeathe to mystres Good wydowe, latelye the wief of doctour
Good Physicion a ryng of gold with a blew stone, and to her dawghter
kynborowghe a ryng withe three lemmowes small/ To mystres Sowthcote a
gold ryng of some pretye fasshion to be made for her to the value of xl s./ To
mr Iohn Sowthcotes wief the yonger a lyke ryng of gold of xl s. price. The
resydew of all my goodes, Cattelles, money, plate, Iewelles, with my debtes to
me owynge not heretofore given & bequeathed (my debtes paid & this my
testament accomplished and perfourmed, and all other necessarye expences
and Charges from tyme to tyme that my executour shalbe at satisfied allowed
and paid) I whollie geue & bequeath porcion & porcion lyke amongest the
children of my brethren and systers/ And thexecutour of this my last will &
testament I make & ordayne my lovyng frend Iustinian kydd gentleman to 2
whome for his frendlie paynes herein to be taken I giue Tenne powndes/ And
overseer of the same I make my foresaid deare frend mr Henry Evans prayeng
him to be assisting] to my executour with his good Councell, and lykewise
to be Carefull for my syster Elizabethe westcote wydowe in her affayres and
busynes as tyme shall serve/ In wytnes whereof I the said Sebastian westcote
to this my last will & testament have putto my hand & seale the daye & yere
abouewrytten/ wytnesses at the sealyng & delyvering hereof/ Signed sealed &
delyveryd as his last will & testament the daye & yere abouesaid as his deed
in the presence of mr Creake, Robert Nycholles, Iohn ore, and Raphe Parys
gentleman, by me Thomas Creake/
Legacies given by the saide Mr Sebastian westcote after the sealyng subscrybing
and delyvering aforesaid the sayd third of Aprill/ To lohn Ore, more then is
conteyned afore tenne shillinges/ To Edward Cooper the Innocent in my
howse Six powndes thirtene shillinges fowre pence To william Gafford fyve
shillinges/ To mother Alyce Tenne shillynges/ To mother Smaley tenne
12/ good: preceded by apparent false start for b or 1

shillinges/ To mother walker tenne shillinges./ To Pole the keper of] the gate
tenne shillinges/ By me Thomas Creake. Robert Nicolles Radulph Paris/ Iohn
Ores mark.
Tercio Aprilis Anno predicto/ More he gave after, theis Legacies aforesaid/ To
everie of mr Raphe Paris Children Tenne shillinges a pece/ To Shepard that
kepeth the dore at Playes tenne shillinges/ More to George Paris tenne
shillinges to make it vp twentye shillynges/ Robert Nicolles.
The said testator after the making of his said will gaue to Catheryne his maid
for that shee tooke greate paines with him in his sicknes more then he gave
her in this former will forty shillinges./
